comment.author: 11847943@N02
comment._content: I am sure that was a delicious meal, after a backbreaking morning... growing up in Puerto Rico, I had the previleged to enjoy raw sugar cane, this image is nostalgic in a way. Thank you.

comment.author: 90081436@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called The frugal kitchen (photo's & recipes), and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 62889126@N00
comment._content: i think that is probably the remnants of rice and beans rather than papaya. Rice and beans has historically been *the* staple dish in PR homes and the beans in PR are cooked with either pumpkin and/or potato and that's what it seems to be there in the container on the right.

comment.author: 12467807@N03
comment._content: Al igual que Carlos Alfaro  pienso que lo que queda en la friambera son los remanentes del arroz con habichuelas y papas.
